description: Parameters needed to calculate an Arrhenius-like rate constant of the form A * exp( -E_a / (k_B * T) ) * ( T / D )^B * (1 + E * P) where T is temperature (K), P is pressure (Pa), E_a is the activation energy (J) for the reaction, k_B is the Boltzmann constant (J/K), and A, B, D, and E are reaction parameters. A parameter C == -E_a / k_B may be specified instead of E_a. Rates will be calculated for units of mol_x / m^3_water where x represents the species participating in the reaction

water.description: Name for water in the condensed phase in which the process operates
